history.empty: There's no history information to display yet.
history.title: History

notice.description: You can login using your Twitch account. This will allow to send a message on your chat with both teams' members and Pokémon, create a prediction about who will win a match and finish it. Check our privacy policy to know how will your data be used. You can hide this message by clicking on it.

playerlist.announcement-details: Send an announcement on your channel's chat with the players and Pokémon in each team.
playerlist.details-input: You can add players by asking them to use your command or manually typing the names and presssing Enter.
playerlist.details-swap: You can drag and drop players to swap their positions.
playerlist.reload-details: Is the player list acting weird? Try to reload the list to fix it.
playerlist.remove-on-rotate: Remove players when rotating a team instead of shuffling them into the waitlist.
playerlist.streamer-mode: Streamer mode: Always keep the first player of the first team when rotating players.
playerlist.title: Players

strategies.all-roles: Guarantee all roles in both teams.
strategies.global-unique-pokemon: Don't repeat Pokémon between both teams.

tour.banlist-description:
You can disable Pokémon so they can't be randomly picked.

Is Mewtwo too OP? You don't want Speedsters to show up? You have the control.
tour.banlist-item-description:
You only need to click on the Pokémon to disable them, and they will be grayed out.

You can re-enable them by clicking on their icon again.
tour.custom-rules-description:
You can enable additional restrictions or rules for the randomizing process.

Make sure 10 different Pokémon are chosen across both teams, or guarantee that there will be a Pokémon from each role in both teams.
tour.finish-description:
You can start using it now! I hope you will find it handy and fun to use with your viewers.

Let the fun and chaos begin!
tour.playerlist-description:
Your players are shown here. Press the X button to remove anyone from the list.

You can also drag-and-drop them to swap their positions.
tour.players-input-description:
You can add players by typing their names here and pressing Enter.

They will be automatically added to any incomplete team, or sent to the waitlist if both teams are already full.
tour.playerlist-rotate-description:
If your match has finished, you can quickly rotate the loser team and let the next players in the waitlist to join.

By default, rotated players are appended to the waitlist in random order, but you can remove them by marking the checkbox so they will require to type !queue again in your chat to be added to the waitlist.
tour.twitch-description: You can also let your viewers add themselves to the playerlist by typing !queue in your chat.
tour.twitch-command-description: When your chat is successfully connected with the application, your viewers will be able to use these commands.
tour.twitch-input-description: To enable these commands, you need to type your channel's name and press the "Connect to chat" button.
tour.twitch-integrate-description: If you identify yourself using your Twitch account (for free!), you will unlock exclusive commands, like letting your viewers know who are the next players in the waitlist and what's their own position in the list.
tour.matchroom-description: Your current players and their Pokémon are displayed here. Fancy, isn't it?
tour.matchroom-buttons-description:
You can use these buttons to shuffle the players in both teams, and randomize the Pokémon they will use.

Make sure to create your room in Tournament Mode and to enable the "All Pokémon Available" option.
tour.matchroom-roster-description: You can re-randomize a single players' Pokémon by clicking on their box. Maybe they already played with that Pokémon in their previous game and you want to let them have a different pick.

twitch.bot-details: Some replies may be sent by TheMimeJr, a bot account. Depending on your channel's restrictions, it may not be able to send messages.
twitch.details: If you connect to your chat, your viewers will be able to join using your command, e.g. !queue. !list command has a 5 seconds cooldown.
twitch.list-no-players: There are no players in the waitlist.
twitch.message-pos: $1, your position in the waitlist is: $2.
twitch.message-pos-none: $1, you are not in the waitlist. Have you used the command to join?
twitch.message-pos-now: $1, you're in the current match, you can enter the room now!
